intro: Habenaria stenostachya subsp. buchneroides, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed marsh orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in wet, boggy habitats and is found in parts of Southeast Asia. It has a rhizomatous root system that helps it survive in waterlogged soils. Its botanical features make it a unique and ecologically important species in its native environment.
